info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 1:36PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Christian County through 115 PM CDT... At 1236 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fort Campbell. This storm was drifting northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Christian County, including the following locations... Herndon. This includes the following highways... Interstate 24 in Kentucky between Mile Markers 73 and 88. Pennyrile Parkway between Mile Markers 1 and 7. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
